column4: Why are people on the ubuntu forums complaining so much about the security in Ubuntu? I have seen some posts saying "There is no firewall by default", but Ubuntu uses IPTables. Do they just think firestarter is the actual firewall?
yes, probably. There are also no open/active ports by default, so little need for a full firewall
because they're used to having to install a whole raft of "security' apps in Windows, and don't realize they're all unneeded in *nix?

True. I am a very paranoid person (and I love security-based things) so I always apply the GRSec patch to any Linux distribution I use. Maybe ubuntu could come default with the GRSec patch or something, since users want better security.
